description: From Latin stēla, from Ancient Greek στήλη (stḗlē). Doublet of stele.

nouns.description: stela (plural stelas or stelae or steles)

entries.meaning: (archaeology) an obelisk or upright stone pillar, usually as a primitive commemoration or gravestone
examples: In the courts of the houses lie many round stelæ, or pillars, once placed on the graves of the Athenians.
